metadata.name: Medieval Portal to Now
metadata.description:
A thousand-year-old arched Medieval doorway opens to the present-day churning waters of the Wild Atlantic Ocean, bridging the centuries while capturing the ever-evolving nature of time and the power of tides.

Both the portal and the ocean are imbued with deep history in this composite image/video.

The doorway and stone walls are from Ireland's historic Rock of Cashel National Monument, seat of Irish Royalty and site of gruesome battles more than 1,000 years ago in County Tipperary.

This section of the Atlantic Ocean on Ireland's rugged West Coast of County Clare became the grave of thousands of sailors when many ships of the Spanish Armada went on the rocks and sank in 1,588.

Though many lives were lost in both epochs, there remains a poignant beauty, a soulful presence.

This piece is part of the "Tides of Time" Collection by Irish Artist James A. Truett.

Artist: James A. Truett  
Location: Ireland  
Dimensions: 2160 x 2700 HD  
Format: MP4  
File Size: 123.6 MB
